data.title: Jesuit Block and Estancias of Córdoba
data.text: The Jesuit Block and Estancias of Crdoba () are a former Jesuit reduction built by missionaries in the province of Crdoba, Argentina, named a World Heritage Site in 2000.The "Manzana Jesutica" contains the University of Crdoba, one of the oldest in South America, the Monserrat Secondary School, a church, and residence buildings. To maintain such a project, the Jesuits operated six "Estancias" (residences) around the province of Crdoba, named Caroya, Jess Mara, Santa Catalina, Alta Gracia, Candelaria, and San Ignacio.
